Sample historic sites and the vibrant cosmopolitan life of Dubai on this tour starting in the popular Jumeirah district. Make a stop at the traditionally recreated Madinat Souk for stunning photos of the iconic Burj Al Arab Hotel then drive onto the man-made Palm Jumeirah island, an incredible architectural marvel for a closer look at another icon, the Atlantis Resort. Continue along Jumeirah Beach, the picturesque palace and residential area of Dubai to a photo-stop at the famed Jumeirah Mosque. Next, head to Al Bastakiya, the old part of Dubai. Pass the Al Fahidi Fort, the ruling family’s former residence and take an Abra (water taxi) to sail across Dubai Creek. Disembark at the Spice Souk where the fragrances of the orient come together then there is time to shop in one of the most visited sites of Dubai – the Gold Souk. Sharing A sad story of investor in Dubaihad worst experience with hashtag#Burjumanmall Al Ghurair Al Ghurair Group management were change right after three months as we leased a shop in BurJuman Mall @al Dubai . unfortunately the new leasing director Vythnathan M. kept pushing us right after joining that we have to relocate or vacate the shop but all verbally and when I sent email to make it confirm he responded officially after a year and sent an letter with courier to vacate the shop within 15days.because this area falls under new development plan. Imagine three months only we completed in the mall as a new tanent and we invest a lot of money. Anyhow we managed to cover almost 18 months while he didn’t offer any feasible location as replacement.I asked three location he refused but those three given to other brands and option which he offered to others now and the one for what we had convinced him a lot, he offered to other brand one in right half rent what he told us and given excuse that this is prime location and we wanted only a well known brand. while it’s the first shop same as us. We signed lease June 2021, vacated on January 2023 and till now that place is empty and new development is not making any impact to that site far and far 😃.The purpose of story is that we lost almost AED 20-25k per month+ investment and time and Imagine December 2022  was the first month we observe business in profit and We were kicked out after rounding all ariund but found helpless. Even The CEO of BurJuman Mall Mr. Ghaith Shocair ignored my several email request for meeting in person. Include with his Secretary.Because CEO himself was the mastermind of Mall’s new development plan. And he offered premium locations to other two brands on same floor while he was pushing us to go on the third floor.Finally with all frustration we quickly shut the shop and lost almost million in one and half year with not even single rent cheque bounced and no compensation from mall management.  Due to loan/financial debt had to sold house in India recently to at least survive and lost health too. Today is the day, struggling for daily bread and butter caused of such huge financial loss. Had invested all life’s earned money with a feasible plan to expand business with new investors etc but wasn’t aware about hashtag#Corrupt people in UAE.Its Fifthhashtag#RamadanKareem in UAE with no new cloths on hashtag#eidulfitr But it’s okay because already health is now on survival condition with no insurance, due medical bill etc.

In 2024, the Dubai Chamber of Commerce achieved a major milestone by issuing and receiving a total of 5,357 ATA Carnets, which facilitated the temporary import of goods valued at an impressive AED 4.3 billion.What does this mean?ATA Carnets, often referred to as "merchandise passports," allow businesses to import goods temporarily, without paying duties or taxes, for up to one year. This is a game-changer for global events like exhibitions and conferences, simplifying customs procedures and ensuring smooth operations for organizers and exhibitors alike.Here’s how it works:🔹 Simplifies customs procedures for temporary imports🔹 Supports international exhibitions, trade shows, and conferences🔹 Enhances the UAE’s position as a global hub for business and eventsThis achievement is a direct result of strong collaboration between Dubai Chamber of Commerce, Dubai Customs، the Federal Customs Authority, and other chambers of commerce across the UAE.It’s exciting to see how the ATA Carnet system continues to strengthen Dubai’s role in global trade and events!How do you think the ATA Carnet system can further support global trade and business events? Sample historic sites and the vibrant cosmopolitan life of Dubai on this tour starting in the popular Jumeirah district. Make a stop at the traditionally recreated Madinat Souk for stunning photos of the iconic Burj Al Arab Hotel then drive onto the man-made Palm Jumeirah island, an incredible architectural marvel for a closer look at another icon, the Atlantis Resort. Continue along Jumeirah Beach, the picturesque palace and residential area of Dubai to a photo-stop at the famed Jumeirah Mosque. Next, head to Al Bastakiya, the old part of Dubai. Pass the Al Fahidi Fort, the ruling family’s former residence and take an Abra (water taxi) to sail across Dubai Creek. Disembark at the Spice Souk where the fragrances of the orient come together then there is time to shop in one of the most visited sites of Dubai – the Gold Souk. Imagine three months only we completed in the mall as a new tanent and we invest a lot of money. We signed lease June 2021, vacated on January 2023 and till now that place is empty and new development is not making any impact to that site far and far 😃.The purpose of story is that we lost almost AED 20-25k per month+ investment and time and Imagine December 2022  was the first month we observe business in profit and We were kicked out after rounding all ariund but found helpless. Even The CEO of BurJuman Mall Mr. Ghaith Shocair ignored my several email request for meeting in person. Include with his Secretary.Because CEO himself was the mastermind of Mall’s new development plan. And he offered premium locations to other two brands on same floor while he was pushing us to go on the third floor.Finally with all frustration we quickly shut the shop and lost almost million in one and half year with not even single rent cheque bounced and no compensation from mall management.  Due to loan/financial debt had to sold house in India recently to at least survive and lost health too. Today is the day, struggling for daily bread and butter caused of such huge financial loss. In 2024, the Dubai Chamber of Commerce achieved a major milestone by issuing and receiving a total of 5,357 ATA Carnets, which facilitated the temporary import of goods valued at an impressive AED 4.3 billion.What does this mean?ATA Carnets, often referred to as "merchandise passports," allow businesses to import goods temporarily, without paying duties or taxes, for up to one year. This is a game-changer for global events like exhibitions and conferences, simplifying customs procedures and ensuring smooth operations for organizers and exhibitors alike.Here’s how it works:🔹 Simplifies customs procedures for temporary imports🔹 Supports international exhibitions, trade shows, and conferences🔹 Enhances the UAE’s position as a global hub for business and eventsThis achievement is a direct result of strong collaboration between Dubai Chamber of Commerce, Dubai Customs، the Federal Customs Authority, and other chambers of commerce across the UAE.It’s exciting to see how the ATA Carnet system continues to strengthen Dubai’s role in global trade and events!How do you think the ATA Carnet system can further support global trade and business events? In 2024, the Dubai Chamber of Commerce achieved a major milestone by issuing and receiving a total of 5,357 ATA Carnets, which facilitated the temporary import of goods valued at an impressive AED 4.3 billion.What does this mean?ATA Carnets, often referred to as "merchandise passports," allow businesses to import goods temporarily, without paying duties or taxes, for up to one year. This is a game-changer for global events like exhibitions and conferences, simplifying customs procedures and ensuring smooth operations for organizers and exhibitors alike.Here’s how it works:🔹 Simplifies customs procedures for temporary imports🔹 Supports international exhibitions, trade shows, and conferences🔹 Enhances the UAE’s position as a global hub for business and eventsThis achievement is a direct result of strong collaboration between Dubai Chamber of Commerce, Dubai Customs، the Federal Customs Authority, and other chambers of commerce across the UAE.It’s exciting to see how the ATA Carnet system continues to strengthen Dubai’s role in global trade and events!How do you think the ATA Carnet system can further support global trade and business events? The UAE isn’t just participating in the global economy—it’s actively redesigning it. With the National Investment Strategy 2031, the country is deploying capital with surgical precision into AI, renewable energy, infrastructure, and global partnerships, transforming itself into the nexus of trade, finance, and innovation. 🌍💡 A Unified Vision with Distinct Emirate Roles: - Abu Dhabi: The AI and energy powerhouse, advancing semiconductor manufacturing and autonomous energy systems. 🤖⚡ - Dubai: The financial and digital assets hub, accelerating cross-border capital flows. 💰🌐 - Ras Al Khaimah: The rising star in tourism and real estate, diversifying the UAE’s economic engine. 🏝️🏠 This isn’t just growth—it’s strategic economic reengineering. 🚀By the Numbers: The UAE’s High-Impact Targets: - FDI Inflows: Surging from $30.5B (2023) to $65.4B (2031). 📈💵 - Foreign Investment Stock: Expanding from $218B to $600B. 📊💼 - Infrastructure: Over 1,000 km of new rail projects underway. 🚆📍 The message to global investors is clear: The UAE is where long-term capital thrives. 💡📈 Abu Dhabi’s AI & Energy Dominance: - Masdar’s 2026 IPO: A 100-gigawatt renewable energy portfolio by 2030, backed by aggressive European and U.S. acquisitions. 🌞🌍 - $3.5B AI Infrastructure Push: The Abu Dhabi Government Digital Strategy 2025-2027 is embedding AI across public and private sectors. 🧠💻 - ADNOC’s Autonomous Energy Systems: A world-first in oil & gas, blending AI with energy production. ⛽🤖 - Semiconductor Supremacy: A $10B fabrication plant to secure the UAE’s role in the global chip supply chain. 🏭💾 Logistics: The UAE’s Silent Weapon in Global Trade: - $100B+ allocated to rail, ports, and metro expansion by 2035. 🚢🚇 - Jebel Ali Port’s AI Expansion: Doubling cargo capacity by 2030. 📦⚙️ - Freight & Passenger Rail Networks: Connecting economic zones, tightening the UAE’s grip on global trade routes. 🌍🚂 The U.S. Partnership: A $25B Strategic Play: The UAE’s latest U.S. commitment targets: ✅ AI-driven energy & infrastructure ✅ Strategic acquisitions in manufacturing & logistics ✅ Direct investments in biotech & tech firms This isn’t just diplomacy—it’s economic leverage. 🤝💡 Financial Gateways: How the UAE Moves Global Capital: - UAE-Australia CEPA: 99% tariff elimination, unlocking trade. 💼🌏 - Abu Dhabi & Shanghai Stock Exchanges: Cross-listed ETFs to bridge capital flows. 📊📈 - Emirates NBD & BlackRock: New private market vehicles, reinforcing the UAE as the capital connector between East and West. 💹💥 The UAE is no longer a regional player—it’s a global architect of economic transformation. With execution speed, sovereign capital, and strategic clarity, it’s rewriting the rules of energy, tech, and finance. 🚀🌍 For investors and executives, the question isn’t if to engage—it’s how fast. ⚡💡

Sample historic sites and the vibrant cosmopolitan life of Dubai on this tour starting in the popular Jumeirah district. Make a stop at the traditionally recreated Madinat Souk for stunning photos of the iconic Burj Al Arab Hotel then drive onto the man-made Palm Jumeirah island, an incredible architectural marvel for a closer look at another icon, the Atlantis Resort. Continue along Jumeirah Beach, the picturesque palace and residential area of Dubai to a photo-stop at the famed Jumeirah Mosque. Next, head to Al Bastakiya, the old part of Dubai. Pass the Al Fahidi Fort, the ruling family’s former residence and take an Abra (water taxi) to sail across Dubai Creek. Disembark at the Spice Souk where the fragrances of the orient come together then there is time to shop in one of the most visited sites of Dubai – the Gold Souk. In 2024, the Dubai Chamber of Commerce achieved a major milestone by issuing and receiving a total of 5,357 ATA Carnets, which facilitated the temporary import of goods valued at an impressive AED 4.3 billion.What does this mean?ATA Carnets, often referred to as "merchandise passports," allow businesses to import goods temporarily, without paying duties or taxes, for up to one year. This is a game-changer for global events like exhibitions and conferences, simplifying customs procedures and ensuring smooth operations for organizers and exhibitors alike.Here’s how it works:🔹 Simplifies customs procedures for temporary imports🔹 Supports international exhibitions, trade shows, and conferences🔹 Enhances the UAE’s position as a global hub for business and eventsThis achievement is a direct result of strong collaboration between Dubai Chamber of Commerce, Dubai Customs، the Federal Customs Authority, and other chambers of commerce across the UAE.It’s exciting to see how the ATA Carnet system continues to strengthen Dubai’s role in global trade and events!How do you think the ATA Carnet system can further support global trade and business events? The UAE isn’t just participating in the global economy—it’s actively redesigning it. With the National Investment Strategy 2031, the country is deploying capital with surgical precision into AI, renewable energy, infrastructure, and global partnerships, transforming itself into the nexus of trade, finance, and innovation. 🌍💡 A Unified Vision with Distinct Emirate Roles: - Abu Dhabi: The AI and energy powerhouse, advancing semiconductor manufacturing and autonomous energy systems. 🤖⚡ - Dubai: The financial and digital assets hub, accelerating cross-border capital flows. 💰🌐 - Ras Al Khaimah: The rising star in tourism and real estate, diversifying the UAE’s economic engine. 🏝️🏠 This isn’t just growth—it’s strategic economic reengineering. 🚀By the Numbers: The UAE’s High-Impact Targets: - FDI Inflows: Surging from $30.5B (2023) to $65.4B (2031). 📈💵 - Foreign Investment Stock: Expanding from $218B to $600B. 📊💼 - Infrastructure: Over 1,000 km of new rail projects underway. 🚆📍 The message to global investors is clear: The UAE is where long-term capital thrives. 💡📈 Abu Dhabi’s AI & Energy Dominance: - Masdar’s 2026 IPO: A 100-gigawatt renewable energy portfolio by 2030, backed by aggressive European and U.S. acquisitions. 🌞🌍 - $3.5B AI Infrastructure Push: The Abu Dhabi Government Digital Strategy 2025-2027 is embedding AI across public and private sectors. 🧠💻 - ADNOC’s Autonomous Energy Systems: A world-first in oil & gas, blending AI with energy production. ⛽🤖 - Semiconductor Supremacy: A $10B fabrication plant to secure the UAE’s role in the global chip supply chain. 🏭💾 Logistics: The UAE’s Silent Weapon in Global Trade: - $100B+ allocated to rail, ports, and metro expansion by 2035. 🚢🚇 - Jebel Ali Port’s AI Expansion: Doubling cargo capacity by 2030. 📦⚙️ - Freight & Passenger Rail Networks: Connecting economic zones, tightening the UAE’s grip on global trade routes. 🌍🚂 The U.S. Partnership: A $25B Strategic Play: The UAE’s latest U.S. commitment targets: ✅ AI-driven energy & infrastructure ✅ Strategic acquisitions in manufacturing & logistics ✅ Direct investments in biotech & tech firms This isn’t just diplomacy—it’s economic leverage. 🤝💡 Financial Gateways: How the UAE Moves Global Capital: - UAE-Australia CEPA: 99% tariff elimination, unlocking trade. 💼🌏 - Abu Dhabi & Shanghai Stock Exchanges: Cross-listed ETFs to bridge capital flows. 📊📈 - Emirates NBD & BlackRock: New private market vehicles, reinforcing the UAE as the capital connector between East and West. 💹💥 The UAE is no longer a regional player—it’s a global architect of economic transformation. With execution speed, sovereign capital, and strategic clarity, it’s rewriting the rules of energy, tech, and finance. 🚀🌍 For investors and executives, the question isn’t if to engage—it’s how fast. ⚡💡

Imagine three months only we completed in the mall as a new tanent and we invest a lot of money. Anyhow we managed to cover almost 18 months while he didn’t offer any feasible location as replacement.I asked three location he refused but those three given to other brands and option which he offered to others now and the one for what we had convinced him a lot, he offered to other brand one in right half rent what he told us and given excuse that this is prime location and we wanted only a well known brand. while it’s the first shop same as us. We signed lease June 2021, vacated on January 2023 and till now that place is empty and new development is not making any impact to that site far and far 😃.The purpose of story is that we lost almost AED 20-25k per month+ investment and time and Imagine December 2022  was the first month we observe business in profit and We were kicked out after rounding all ariund but found helpless. Even The CEO of BurJuman Mall Mr. Ghaith Shocair ignored my several email request for meeting in person. Include with his Secretary.Because CEO himself was the mastermind of Mall’s new development plan. And he offered premium locations to other two brands on same floor while he was pushing us to go on the third floor.Finally with all frustration we quickly shut the shop and lost almost million in one and half year with not even single rent cheque bounced and no compensation from mall management.  Due to loan/financial debt had to sold house in India recently to at least survive and lost health too. Today is the day, struggling for daily bread and butter caused of such huge financial loss. In 2024, the Dubai Chamber of Commerce achieved a major milestone by issuing and receiving a total of 5,357 ATA Carnets, which facilitated the temporary import of goods valued at an impressive AED 4.3 billion.What does this mean?ATA Carnets, often referred to as "merchandise passports," allow businesses to import goods temporarily, without paying duties or taxes, for up to one year. This is a game-changer for global events like exhibitions and conferences, simplifying customs procedures and ensuring smooth operations for organizers and exhibitors alike.Here’s how it works:🔹 Simplifies customs procedures for temporary imports🔹 Supports international exhibitions, trade shows, and conferences🔹 Enhances the UAE’s position as a global hub for business and eventsThis achievement is a direct result of strong collaboration between Dubai Chamber of Commerce, Dubai Customs، the Federal Customs Authority, and other chambers of commerce across the UAE.It’s exciting to see how the ATA Carnet system continues to strengthen Dubai’s role in global trade and events!How do you think the ATA Carnet system can further support global trade and business events? The UAE isn’t just participating in the global economy—it’s actively redesigning it. With the National Investment Strategy 2031, the country is deploying capital with surgical precision into AI, renewable energy, infrastructure, and global partnerships, transforming itself into the nexus of trade, finance, and innovation. 🌍💡 A Unified Vision with Distinct Emirate Roles: - Abu Dhabi: The AI and energy powerhouse, advancing semiconductor manufacturing and autonomous energy systems. 🤖⚡ - Dubai: The financial and digital assets hub, accelerating cross-border capital flows. 💰🌐 - Ras Al Khaimah: The rising star in tourism and real estate, diversifying the UAE’s economic engine. 🏝️🏠 This isn’t just growth—it’s strategic economic reengineering. 🚀By the Numbers: The UAE’s High-Impact Targets: - FDI Inflows: Surging from $30.5B (2023) to $65.4B (2031). 📈💵 - Foreign Investment Stock: Expanding from $218B to $600B. 📊💼 - Infrastructure: Over 1,000 km of new rail projects underway. 🚆📍 The message to global investors is clear: The UAE is where long-term capital thrives. 💡📈 Abu Dhabi’s AI & Energy Dominance: - Masdar’s 2026 IPO: A 100-gigawatt renewable energy portfolio by 2030, backed by aggressive European and U.S. acquisitions. 🌞🌍 - $3.5B AI Infrastructure Push: The Abu Dhabi Government Digital Strategy 2025-2027 is embedding AI across public and private sectors. 🧠💻 - ADNOC’s Autonomous Energy Systems: A world-first in oil & gas, blending AI with energy production. ⛽🤖 - Semiconductor Supremacy: A $10B fabrication plant to secure the UAE’s role in the global chip supply chain. 🏭💾 Logistics: The UAE’s Silent Weapon in Global Trade: - $100B+ allocated to rail, ports, and metro expansion by 2035. 🚢🚇 - Jebel Ali Port’s AI Expansion: Doubling cargo capacity by 2030. 📦⚙️ - Freight & Passenger Rail Networks: Connecting economic zones, tightening the UAE’s grip on global trade routes. 🌍🚂 The U.S. Partnership: A $25B Strategic Play: The UAE’s latest U.S. commitment targets: ✅ AI-driven energy & infrastructure ✅ Strategic acquisitions in manufacturing & logistics ✅ Direct investments in biotech & tech firms This isn’t just diplomacy—it’s economic leverage. 🤝💡 Financial Gateways: How the UAE Moves Global Capital: - UAE-Australia CEPA: 99% tariff elimination, unlocking trade. 💼🌏 - Abu Dhabi & Shanghai Stock Exchanges: Cross-listed ETFs to bridge capital flows. 📊📈 - Emirates NBD & BlackRock: New private market vehicles, reinforcing the UAE as the capital connector between East and West. 💹💥 The UAE is no longer a regional player—it’s a global architect of economic transformation. With execution speed, sovereign capital, and strategic clarity, it’s rewriting the rules of energy, tech, and finance. 🚀🌍 For investors and executives, the question isn’t if to engage—it’s how fast. ⚡💡

Sample historic sites and the vibrant cosmopolitan life of Dubai on this tour starting in the popular Jumeirah district. Make a stop at the traditionally recreated Madinat Souk for stunning photos of the iconic Burj Al Arab Hotel then drive onto the man-made Palm Jumeirah island, an incredible architectural marvel for a closer look at another icon, the Atlantis Resort. Continue along Jumeirah Beach, the picturesque palace and residential area of Dubai to a photo-stop at the famed Jumeirah Mosque. Next, head to Al Bastakiya, the old part of Dubai. Pass the Al Fahidi Fort, the ruling family’s former residence and take an Abra (water taxi) to sail across Dubai Creek. Disembark at the Spice Souk where the fragrances of the orient come together then there is time to shop in one of the most visited sites of Dubai – the Gold Souk. Sharing A sad story of investor in Dubaihad worst experience with hashtag#Burjumanmall Al Ghurair Al Ghurair Group management were change right after three months as we leased a shop in BurJuman Mall @al Dubai . unfortunately the new leasing director Vythnathan M. kept pushing us right after joining that we have to relocate or vacate the shop but all verbally and when I sent email to make it confirm he responded officially after a year and sent an letter with courier to vacate the shop within 15days.because this area falls under new development plan. Imagine three months only we completed in the mall as a new tanent and we invest a lot of money. Anyhow we managed to cover almost 18 months while he didn’t offer any feasible location as replacement.I asked three location he refused but those three given to other brands and option which he offered to others now and the one for what we had convinced him a lot, he offered to other brand one in right half rent what he told us and given excuse that this is prime location and we wanted only a well known brand. while it’s the first shop same as us. We signed lease June 2021, vacated on January 2023 and till now that place is empty and new development is not making any impact to that site far and far 😃.The purpose of story is that we lost almost AED 20-25k per month+ investment and time and Imagine December 2022  was the first month we observe business in profit and We were kicked out after rounding all ariund but found helpless. Even The CEO of BurJuman Mall Mr. Ghaith Shocair ignored my several email request for meeting in person. Include with his Secretary.Because CEO himself was the mastermind of Mall’s new development plan. And he offered premium locations to other two brands on same floor while he was pushing us to go on the third floor.Finally with all frustration we quickly shut the shop and lost almost million in one and half year with not even single rent cheque bounced and no compensation from mall management.  Due to loan/financial debt had to sold house in India recently to at least survive and lost health too. Today is the day, struggling for daily bread and butter caused of such huge financial loss. Had invested all life’s earned money with a feasible plan to expand business with new investors etc but wasn’t aware about hashtag#Corrupt people in UAE.Its Fifthhashtag#RamadanKareem in UAE with no new cloths on hashtag#eidulfitr But it’s okay because already health is now on survival condition with no insurance, due medical bill etc.

I never knew safety like this—until I moved to the UAE 🇦🇪A few months ago, when I moved to the UAE from Pakistan 🇵🇰, I was excited for new opportunities but unsure of what awaited me.One night, after a long day, I decided to go for a walk. Sipping on a warm cup of Karak tea while taking in the beauty of the city! ☕🌆That moment made me realize why the UAE is now ranked the 2nd safest country in the world! 🌟This isn’t just about rankings—it’s something I’ve truly felt over the past few months. ❤️Safety here is a lifestyle, not just a statistic.✨I’ve lived in different places, but this level of security is rare. 🤍It allows people to focus on growth, opportunities, and living life without fear. 🚀💬 What's the safest place you've lived, and what made it special for you?hashtag#UAESafety 🇦🇪 hashtag#2ndsafestcountry hashtag#LifeInUAE hashtag#ExpatLife hashtag#NewOpportunities hashtag#UAEExperience hashtag#Dubai

In 2024, the Dubai Chamber of Commerce achieved a major milestone by issuing and receiving a total of 5,357 ATA Carnets, which facilitated the temporary import of goods valued at an impressive AED 4.3 billion.What does this mean?ATA Carnets, often referred to as "merchandise passports," allow businesses to import goods temporarily, without paying duties or taxes, for up to one year. This is a game-changer for global events like exhibitions and conferences, simplifying customs procedures and ensuring smooth operations for organizers and exhibitors alike.Here’s how it works:🔹 Simplifies customs procedures for temporary imports🔹 Supports international exhibitions, trade shows, and conferences🔹 Enhances the UAE’s position as a global hub for business and eventsThis achievement is a direct result of strong collaboration between Dubai Chamber of Commerce, Dubai Customs، the Federal Customs Authority, and other chambers of commerce across the UAE.It’s exciting to see how the ATA Carnet system continues to strengthen Dubai’s role in global trade and events!How do you think the ATA Carnet system can further support global trade and business events? Let’s hear your thoughts in the comments! hashtag#Dubai hashtag#InternationalTrade hashtag#ATAcarnet hashtag#GlobalEvents hashtag#Exhibitions hashtag#Customs hashtag#BusinessHub hashtag#UAE hashtag#TradeFacilitation hashtag#EventPlanning https://buff.ly/kGETdND

The UAE isn’t just participating in the global economy—it’s actively redesigning it. With the National Investment Strategy 2031, the country is deploying capital with surgical precision into AI, renewable energy, infrastructure, and global partnerships, transforming itself into the nexus of trade, finance, and innovation. 🌍💡 A Unified Vision with Distinct Emirate Roles: - Abu Dhabi: The AI and energy powerhouse, advancing semiconductor manufacturing and autonomous energy systems. 🤖⚡ - Dubai: The financial and digital assets hub, accelerating cross-border capital flows. 💰🌐 - Ras Al Khaimah: The rising star in tourism and real estate, diversifying the UAE’s economic engine. 🏝️🏠 This isn’t just growth—it’s strategic economic reengineering. 🚀By the Numbers: The UAE’s High-Impact Targets: - FDI Inflows: Surging from $30.5B (2023) to $65.4B (2031). 📈💵 - Foreign Investment Stock: Expanding from $218B to $600B. 📊💼 - Infrastructure: Over 1,000 km of new rail projects underway. 🚆📍 The message to global investors is clear: The UAE is where long-term capital thrives. 💡📈 Abu Dhabi’s AI & Energy Dominance: - Masdar’s 2026 IPO: A 100-gigawatt renewable energy portfolio by 2030, backed by aggressive European and U.S. acquisitions. 🌞🌍 - $3.5B AI Infrastructure Push: The Abu Dhabi Government Digital Strategy 2025-2027 is embedding AI across public and private sectors. 🧠💻 - ADNOC’s Autonomous Energy Systems: A world-first in oil & gas, blending AI with energy production. ⛽🤖 - Semiconductor Supremacy: A $10B fabrication plant to secure the UAE’s role in the global chip supply chain. 🏭💾 Logistics: The UAE’s Silent Weapon in Global Trade: - $100B+ allocated to rail, ports, and metro expansion by 2035. 🚢🚇 - Jebel Ali Port’s AI Expansion: Doubling cargo capacity by 2030. 📦⚙️ - Freight & Passenger Rail Networks: Connecting economic zones, tightening the UAE’s grip on global trade routes. 🌍🚂 The U.S. Partnership: A $25B Strategic Play: The UAE’s latest U.S. commitment targets: ✅ AI-driven energy & infrastructure ✅ Strategic acquisitions in manufacturing & logistics ✅ Direct investments in biotech & tech firms This isn’t just diplomacy—it’s economic leverage. 🤝💡 Financial Gateways: How the UAE Moves Global Capital: - UAE-Australia CEPA: 99% tariff elimination, unlocking trade. 💼🌏 - Abu Dhabi & Shanghai Stock Exchanges: Cross-listed ETFs to bridge capital flows. 📊📈 - Emirates NBD & BlackRock: New private market vehicles, reinforcing the UAE as the capital connector between East and West. 💹💥 The UAE is no longer a regional player—it’s a global architect of economic transformation. With execution speed, sovereign capital, and strategic clarity, it’s rewriting the rules of energy, tech, and finance. 🚀🌍 For investors and executives, the question isn’t if to engage—it’s how fast. ⚡💡

Sample historic sites and the vibrant cosmopolitan life of Dubai on this tour starting in the popular Jumeirah district. Make a stop at the traditionally recreated Madinat Souk for stunning photos of the iconic Burj Al Arab Hotel then drive onto the man-made Palm Jumeirah island, an incredible architectural marvel for a closer look at another icon, the Atlantis Resort. Continue along Jumeirah Beach, the picturesque palace and residential area of Dubai to a photo-stop at the famed Jumeirah Mosque. Next, head to Al Bastakiya, the old part of Dubai. Pass the Al Fahidi Fort, the ruling family’s former residence and take an Abra (water taxi) to sail across Dubai Creek. Disembark at the Spice Souk where the fragrances of the orient come together then there is time to shop in one of the most visited sites of Dubai – the Gold Souk. Sharing A sad story of investor in Dubaihad worst experience with hashtag#Burjumanmall Al Ghurair Al Ghurair Group management were change right after three months as we leased a shop in BurJuman Mall @al Dubai . unfortunately the new leasing director Vythnathan M. kept pushing us right after joining that we have to relocate or vacate the shop but all verbally and when I sent email to make it confirm he responded officially after a year and sent an letter with courier to vacate the shop within 15days.because this area falls under new development plan. Imagine three months only we completed in the mall as a new tanent and we invest a lot of money. Anyhow we managed to cover almost 18 months while he didn’t offer any feasible location as replacement.I asked three location he refused but those three given to other brands and option which he offered to others now and the one for what we had convinced him a lot, he offered to other brand one in right half rent what he told us and given excuse that this is prime location and we wanted only a well known brand. while it’s the first shop same as us. We signed lease June 2021, vacated on January 2023 and till now that place is empty and new development is not making any impact to that site far and far 😃.The purpose of story is that we lost almost AED 20-25k per month+ investment and time and Imagine December 2022  was the first month we observe business in profit and We were kicked out after rounding all ariund but found helpless. Even The CEO of BurJuman Mall Mr. Ghaith Shocair ignored my several email request for meeting in person. Include with his Secretary.Because CEO himself was the mastermind of Mall’s new development plan. And he offered premium locations to other two brands on same floor while he was pushing us to go on the third floor.Finally with all frustration we quickly shut the shop and lost almost million in one and half year with not even single rent cheque bounced and no compensation from mall management.  Due to loan/financial debt had to sold house in India recently to at least survive and lost health too. Today is the day, struggling for daily bread and butter caused of such huge financial loss. Had invested all life’s earned money with a feasible plan to expand business with new investors etc but wasn’t aware about hashtag#Corrupt people in UAE.Its Fifthhashtag#RamadanKareem in UAE with no new cloths on hashtag#eidulfitr But it’s okay because already health is now on survival condition with no insurance, due medical bill etc.

In 2024, the Dubai Chamber of Commerce achieved a major milestone by issuing and receiving a total of 5,357 ATA Carnets, which facilitated the temporary import of goods valued at an impressive AED 4.3 billion.What does this mean?ATA Carnets, often referred to as "merchandise passports," allow businesses to import goods temporarily, without paying duties or taxes, for up to one year. This is a game-changer for global events like exhibitions and conferences, simplifying customs procedures and ensuring smooth operations for organizers and exhibitors alike.Here’s how it works:🔹 Simplifies customs procedures for temporary imports🔹 Supports international exhibitions, trade shows, and conferences🔹 Enhances the UAE’s position as a global hub for business and eventsThis achievement is a direct result of strong collaboration between Dubai Chamber of Commerce, Dubai Customs، the Federal Customs Authority, and other chambers of commerce across the UAE.It’s exciting to see how the ATA Carnet system continues to strengthen Dubai’s role in global trade and events!How do you think the ATA Carnet system can further support global trade and business events? The UAE isn’t just participating in the global economy—it’s actively redesigning it. With the National Investment Strategy 2031, the country is deploying capital with surgical precision into AI, renewable energy, infrastructure, and global partnerships, transforming itself into the nexus of trade, finance, and innovation. 🌍💡 A Unified Vision with Distinct Emirate Roles: - Abu Dhabi: The AI and energy powerhouse, advancing semiconductor manufacturing and autonomous energy systems. 🤖⚡ - Dubai: The financial and digital assets hub, accelerating cross-border capital flows. 💰🌐 - Ras Al Khaimah: The rising star in tourism and real estate, diversifying the UAE’s economic engine. 🏝️🏠 This isn’t just growth—it’s strategic economic reengineering. 🚀By the Numbers: The UAE’s High-Impact Targets: - FDI Inflows: Surging from $30.5B (2023) to $65.4B (2031). 📈💵 - Foreign Investment Stock: Expanding from $218B to $600B. 📊💼 - Infrastructure: Over 1,000 km of new rail projects underway. 🚆📍 The message to global investors is clear: The UAE is where long-term capital thrives. 💡📈 Abu Dhabi’s AI & Energy Dominance: - Masdar’s 2026 IPO: A 100-gigawatt renewable energy portfolio by 2030, backed by aggressive European and U.S. acquisitions. 🌞🌍 - $3.5B AI Infrastructure Push: The Abu Dhabi Government Digital Strategy 2025-2027 is embedding AI across public and private sectors. 🧠💻 - ADNOC’s Autonomous Energy Systems: A world-first in oil & gas, blending AI with energy production. ⛽🤖 - Semiconductor Supremacy: A $10B fabrication plant to secure the UAE’s role in the global chip supply chain. 🏭💾 Logistics: The UAE’s Silent Weapon in Global Trade: - $100B+ allocated to rail, ports, and metro expansion by 2035. 🚢🚇 - Jebel Ali Port’s AI Expansion: Doubling cargo capacity by 2030. 📦⚙️ - Freight & Passenger Rail Networks: Connecting economic zones, tightening the UAE’s grip on global trade routes. 🌍🚂 The U.S. Partnership: A $25B Strategic Play: The UAE’s latest U.S. commitment targets: ✅ AI-driven energy & infrastructure ✅ Strategic acquisitions in manufacturing & logistics ✅ Direct investments in biotech & tech firms This isn’t just diplomacy—it’s economic leverage. 🤝💡 Financial Gateways: How the UAE Moves Global Capital: - UAE-Australia CEPA: 99% tariff elimination, unlocking trade. 💼🌏 - Abu Dhabi & Shanghai Stock Exchanges: Cross-listed ETFs to bridge capital flows. 📊📈 - Emirates NBD & BlackRock: New private market vehicles, reinforcing the UAE as the capital connector between East and West. 💹💥 The UAE is no longer a regional player—it’s a global architect of economic transformation. With execution speed, sovereign capital, and strategic clarity, it’s rewriting the rules of energy, tech, and finance. 🚀🌍 For investors and executives, the question isn’t if to engage—it’s how fast. ⚡💡

Sample historic sites and the vibrant cosmopolitan life of Dubai on this tour starting in the popular Jumeirah district. Make a stop at the traditionally recreated Madinat Souk for stunning photos of the iconic Burj Al Arab Hotel then drive onto the man-made Palm Jumeirah island, an incredible architectural marvel for a closer look at another icon, the Atlantis Resort. Continue along Jumeirah Beach, the picturesque palace and residential area of Dubai to a photo-stop at the famed Jumeirah Mosque. Next, head to Al Bastakiya, the old part of Dubai. Pass the Al Fahidi Fort, the ruling family’s former residence and take an Abra (water taxi) to sail across Dubai Creek. Disembark at the Spice Souk where the fragrances of the orient come together then there is time to shop in one of the most visited sites of Dubai – the Gold Souk. Sharing A sad story of investor in Dubaihad worst experience with hashtag#Burjumanmall Al Ghurair Al Ghurair Group management were change right after three months as we leased a shop in BurJuman Mall @al Dubai . unfortunately the new leasing director Vythnathan M. kept pushing us right after joining that we have to relocate or vacate the shop but all verbally and when I sent email to make it confirm he responded officially after a year and sent an letter with courier to vacate the shop within 15days.because this area falls under new development plan. Imagine three months only we completed in the mall as a new tanent and we invest a lot of money. Anyhow we managed to cover almost 18 months while he didn’t offer any feasible location as replacement.I asked three location he refused but those three given to other brands and option which he offered to others now and the one for what we had convinced him a lot, he offered to other brand one in right half rent what he told us and given excuse that this is prime location and we wanted only a well known brand. while it’s the first shop same as us. We signed lease June 2021, vacated on January 2023 and till now that place is empty and new development is not making any impact to that site far and far 😃.The purpose of story is that we lost almost AED 20-25k per month+ investment and time and Imagine December 2022  was the first month we observe business in profit and We were kicked out after rounding all ariund but found helpless. Even The CEO of BurJuman Mall Mr. Ghaith Shocair ignored my several email request for meeting in person. Include with his Secretary.Because CEO himself was the mastermind of Mall’s new development plan. And he offered premium locations to other two brands on same floor while he was pushing us to go on the third floor.Finally with all frustration we quickly shut the shop and lost almost million in one and half year with not even single rent cheque bounced and no compensation from mall management.  Due to loan/financial debt had to sold house in India recently to at least survive and lost health too. Today is the day, struggling for daily bread and butter caused of such huge financial loss. Had invested all life’s earned money with a feasible plan to expand business with new investors etc but wasn’t aware about hashtag#Corrupt people in UAE.Its Fifthhashtag#RamadanKareem in UAE with no new cloths on hashtag#eidulfitr But it’s okay because already health is now on survival condition with no insurance, due medical bill etc.

I never knew safety like this—until I moved to the UAE 🇦🇪A few months ago, when I moved to the UAE from Pakistan 🇵🇰, I was excited for new opportunities but unsure of what awaited me.One night, after a long day, I decided to go for a walk. It was late, but the streets were calm, bright, and full of life. 🌃✅Families were out, enjoying their time without worry 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦✅ Tourists were taking photos, feeling completely safe 📸✅ A police patrol car drove by, ensuring security 🚔✅ Streets were clean, well-lit, and monitored 24/7 💡✅ People walked freely, with no fear of crime or danger 🚶‍♀️✅ A true sense of peace and safety in every corner ❤️And the best part? Sipping on a warm cup of Karak tea while taking in the beauty of the city! ☕🌆That moment made me realize why the UAE is now ranked the 2nd safest country in the world! 🌟This isn’t just about rankings—it’s something I’ve truly felt over the past few months. ❤️Safety here is a lifestyle, not just a statistic.✨I’ve lived in different places, but this level of security is rare. 🤍It allows people to focus on growth, opportunities, and living life without fear. 🚀💬 What's the safest place you've lived, and what made it special for you?hashtag#UAESafety 🇦🇪 hashtag#2ndsafestcountry hashtag#LifeInUAE hashtag#ExpatLife hashtag#NewOpportunities hashtag#UAEExperience hashtag#Dubai

In 2024, the Dubai Chamber of Commerce achieved a major milestone by issuing and receiving a total of 5,357 ATA Carnets, which facilitated the temporary import of goods valued at an impressive AED 4.3 billion.What does this mean?ATA Carnets, often referred to as "merchandise passports," allow businesses to import goods temporarily, without paying duties or taxes, for up to one year. This is a game-changer for global events like exhibitions and conferences, simplifying customs procedures and ensuring smooth operations for organizers and exhibitors alike.Here’s how it works:🔹 Simplifies customs procedures for temporary imports🔹 Supports international exhibitions, trade shows, and conferences🔹 Enhances the UAE’s position as a global hub for business and eventsThis achievement is a direct result of strong collaboration between Dubai Chamber of Commerce, Dubai Customs، the Federal Customs Authority, and other chambers of commerce across the UAE.It’s exciting to see how the ATA Carnet system continues to strengthen Dubai’s role in global trade and events!How do you think the ATA Carnet system can further support global trade and business events? Let’s hear your thoughts in the comments! hashtag#Dubai hashtag#InternationalTrade hashtag#ATAcarnet hashtag#GlobalEvents hashtag#Exhibitions hashtag#Customs hashtag#BusinessHub hashtag#UAE hashtag#TradeFacilitation hashtag#EventPlanning https://buff.ly/kGETdND

The UAE isn’t just participating in the global economy—it’s actively redesigning it. With the National Investment Strategy 2031, the country is deploying capital with surgical precision into AI, renewable energy, infrastructure, and global partnerships, transforming itself into the nexus of trade, finance, and innovation. 🌍💡 A Unified Vision with Distinct Emirate Roles: - Abu Dhabi: The AI and energy powerhouse, advancing semiconductor manufacturing and autonomous energy systems. 🤖⚡ - Dubai: The financial and digital assets hub, accelerating cross-border capital flows. 💰🌐 - Ras Al Khaimah: The rising star in tourism and real estate, diversifying the UAE’s economic engine. 🏝️🏠 This isn’t just growth—it’s strategic economic reengineering. 🚀By the Numbers: The UAE’s High-Impact Targets: - FDI Inflows: Surging from $30.5B (2023) to $65.4B (2031). 📈💵 - Foreign Investment Stock: Expanding from $218B to $600B. 📊💼 - Infrastructure: Over 1,000 km of new rail projects underway. 🚆📍 The message to global investors is clear: The UAE is where long-term capital thrives. 💡📈 Abu Dhabi’s AI & Energy Dominance: - Masdar’s 2026 IPO: A 100-gigawatt renewable energy portfolio by 2030, backed by aggressive European and U.S. acquisitions. 🌞🌍 - $3.5B AI Infrastructure Push: The Abu Dhabi Government Digital Strategy 2025-2027 is embedding AI across public and private sectors. 🧠💻 - ADNOC’s Autonomous Energy Systems: A world-first in oil & gas, blending AI with energy production. ⛽🤖 - Semiconductor Supremacy: A $10B fabrication plant to secure the UAE’s role in the global chip supply chain. 🏭💾 Logistics: The UAE’s Silent Weapon in Global Trade: - $100B+ allocated to rail, ports, and metro expansion by 2035. 🚢🚇 - Jebel Ali Port’s AI Expansion: Doubling cargo capacity by 2030. 📦⚙️ - Freight & Passenger Rail Networks: Connecting economic zones, tightening the UAE’s grip on global trade routes. 🌍🚂 The U.S. Partnership: A $25B Strategic Play: The UAE’s latest U.S. commitment targets: ✅ AI-driven energy & infrastructure ✅ Strategic acquisitions in manufacturing & logistics ✅ Direct investments in biotech & tech firms This isn’t just diplomacy—it’s economic leverage. 🤝💡 Financial Gateways: How the UAE Moves Global Capital: - UAE-Australia CEPA: 99% tariff elimination, unlocking trade. 💼🌏 - Abu Dhabi & Shanghai Stock Exchanges: Cross-listed ETFs to bridge capital flows. 📊📈 - Emirates NBD & BlackRock: New private market vehicles, reinforcing the UAE as the capital connector between East and West. 💹💥 The UAE is no longer a regional player—it’s a global architect of economic transformation. With execution speed, sovereign capital, and strategic clarity, it’s rewriting the rules of energy, tech, and finance. 🚀🌍 For investors and executives, the question isn’t if to engage—it’s how fast. ⚡💡

Include with his Secretary.Because CEO himself was the mastermind of Mall’s new development plan. And he offered premium locations to other two brands on same floor while he was pushing us to go on the third floor.Finally with all frustration we quickly shut the shop and lost almost million in one and half year with not even single rent cheque bounced and no compensation from mall management. In 2024, the Dubai Chamber of Commerce achieved a major milestone by issuing and receiving a total of 5,357 ATA Carnets, which facilitated the temporary import of goods valued at an impressive AED 4.3 billion.What does this mean?ATA Carnets, often referred to as "merchandise passports," allow businesses to import goods temporarily, without paying duties or taxes, for up to one year. This is a game-changer for global events like exhibitions and conferences, simplifying customs procedures and ensuring smooth operations for organizers and exhibitors alike.Here’s how it works:🔹 Simplifies customs procedures for temporary imports🔹 Supports international exhibitions, trade shows, and conferences🔹 Enhances the UAE’s position as a global hub for business and eventsThis achievement is a direct result of strong collaboration between Dubai Chamber of Commerce, Dubai Customs، the Federal Customs Authority, and other chambers of commerce across the UAE.It’s exciting to see how the ATA Carnet system continues to strengthen Dubai’s role in global trade and events!How do you think the ATA Carnet system can further support global trade and business events? The UAE isn’t just participating in the global economy—it’s actively redesigning it. With the National Investment Strategy 2031, the country is deploying capital with surgical precision into AI, renewable energy, infrastructure, and global partnerships, transforming itself into the nexus of trade, finance, and innovation. 🌍💡 A Unified Vision with Distinct Emirate Roles: - Abu Dhabi: The AI and energy powerhouse, advancing semiconductor manufacturing and autonomous energy systems. 🤖⚡ - Dubai: The financial and digital assets hub, accelerating cross-border capital flows. 💰🌐 - Ras Al Khaimah: The rising star in tourism and real estate, diversifying the UAE’s economic engine. 🏝️🏠 This isn’t just growth—it’s strategic economic reengineering. 🚀By the Numbers: The UAE’s High-Impact Targets: - FDI Inflows: Surging from $30.5B (2023) to $65.4B (2031). 📈💵 - Foreign Investment Stock: Expanding from $218B to $600B. 📊💼 - Infrastructure: Over 1,000 km of new rail projects underway. 🚆📍 The message to global investors is clear: The UAE is where long-term capital thrives. 💡📈 Abu Dhabi’s AI & Energy Dominance: - Masdar’s 2026 IPO: A 100-gigawatt renewable energy portfolio by 2030, backed by aggressive European and U.S. acquisitions. 🌞🌍 - $3.5B AI Infrastructure Push: The Abu Dhabi Government Digital Strategy 2025-2027 is embedding AI across public and private sectors. 🧠💻 - ADNOC’s Autonomous Energy Systems: A world-first in oil & gas, blending AI with energy production. ⛽🤖 - Semiconductor Supremacy: A $10B fabrication plant to secure the UAE’s role in the global chip supply chain. 🏭💾 Logistics: The UAE’s Silent Weapon in Global Trade: - $100B+ allocated to rail, ports, and metro expansion by 2035. 🚢🚇 - Jebel Ali Port’s AI Expansion: Doubling cargo capacity by 2030. 📦⚙️ - Freight & Passenger Rail Networks: Connecting economic zones, tightening the UAE’s grip on global trade routes. 🌍🚂 The U.S. Partnership: A $25B Strategic Play: The UAE’s latest U.S. commitment targets: ✅ AI-driven energy & infrastructure ✅ Strategic acquisitions in manufacturing & logistics ✅ Direct investments in biotech & tech firms This isn’t just diplomacy—it’s economic leverage. 🤝💡 Financial Gateways: How the UAE Moves Global Capital: - UAE-Australia CEPA: 99% tariff elimination, unlocking trade. 💼🌏 - Abu Dhabi & Shanghai Stock Exchanges: Cross-listed ETFs to bridge capital flows. 📊📈 - Emirates NBD & BlackRock: New private market vehicles, reinforcing the UAE as the capital connector between East and West. 💹💥 The UAE is no longer a regional player—it’s a global architect of economic transformation. With execution speed, sovereign capital, and strategic clarity, it’s rewriting the rules of energy, tech, and finance. 🚀🌍 For investors and executives, the question isn’t if to engage—it’s how fast. ⚡💡

Sharing A sad story of investor in Dubaihad worst experience with hashtag#Burjumanmall Al Ghurair Al Ghurair Group management were change right after three months as we leased a shop in BurJuman Mall @al Dubai . unfortunately the new leasing director Vythnathan M. kept pushing us right after joining that we have to relocate or vacate the shop but all verbally and when I sent email to make it confirm he responded officially after a year and sent an letter with courier to vacate the shop within 15days.because this area falls under new development plan. Imagine three months only we completed in the mall as a new tanent and we invest a lot of money. Anyhow we managed to cover almost 18 months while he didn’t offer any feasible location as replacement.I asked three location he refused but those three given to other brands and option which he offered to others now and the one for what we had convinced him a lot, he offered to other brand one in right half rent what he told us and given excuse that this is prime location and we wanted only a well known brand. while it’s the first shop same as us. We signed lease June 2021, vacated on January 2023 and till now that place is empty and new development is not making any impact to that site far and far 😃.The purpose of story is that we lost almost AED 20-25k per month+ investment and time and Imagine December 2022  was the first month we observe business in profit and We were kicked out after rounding all ariund but found helpless. Even The CEO of BurJuman Mall Mr. Ghaith Shocair ignored my several email request for meeting in person. Include with his Secretary.Because CEO himself was the mastermind of Mall’s new development plan. And he offered premium locations to other two brands on same floor while he was pushing us to go on the third floor.Finally with all frustration we quickly shut the shop and lost almost million in one and half year with not even single rent cheque bounced and no compensation from mall management.  Due to loan/financial debt had to sold house in India recently to at least survive and lost health too. Today is the day, struggling for daily bread and butter caused of such huge financial loss. In 2024, the Dubai Chamber of Commerce achieved a major milestone by issuing and receiving a total of 5,357 ATA Carnets, which facilitated the temporary import of goods valued at an impressive AED 4.3 billion.What does this mean?ATA Carnets, often referred to as "merchandise passports," allow businesses to import goods temporarily, without paying duties or taxes, for up to one year. This is a game-changer for global events like exhibitions and conferences, simplifying customs procedures and ensuring smooth operations for organizers and exhibitors alike.Here’s how it works:🔹 Simplifies customs procedures for temporary imports🔹 Supports international exhibitions, trade shows, and conferences🔹 Enhances the UAE’s position as a global hub for business and eventsThis achievement is a direct result of strong collaboration between Dubai Chamber of Commerce, Dubai Customs، the Federal Customs Authority, and other chambers of commerce across the UAE.It’s exciting to see how the ATA Carnet system continues to strengthen Dubai’s role in global trade and events!How do you think the ATA Carnet system can further support global trade and business events? The UAE isn’t just participating in the global economy—it’s actively redesigning it. With the National Investment Strategy 2031, the country is deploying capital with surgical precision into AI, renewable energy, infrastructure, and global partnerships, transforming itself into the nexus of trade, finance, and innovation. 🌍💡 A Unified Vision with Distinct Emirate Roles: - Abu Dhabi: The AI and energy powerhouse, advancing semiconductor manufacturing and autonomous energy systems. 🤖⚡ - Dubai: The financial and digital assets hub, accelerating cross-border capital flows. 💰🌐 - Ras Al Khaimah: The rising star in tourism and real estate, diversifying the UAE’s economic engine. 🏝️🏠 This isn’t just growth—it’s strategic economic reengineering. 🚀By the Numbers: The UAE’s High-Impact Targets: - FDI Inflows: Surging from $30.5B (2023) to $65.4B (2031). 📈💵 - Foreign Investment Stock: Expanding from $218B to $600B. 📊💼 - Infrastructure: Over 1,000 km of new rail projects underway. 🚆📍 The message to global investors is clear: The UAE is where long-term capital thrives. 💡📈 Abu Dhabi’s AI & Energy Dominance: - Masdar’s 2026 IPO: A 100-gigawatt renewable energy portfolio by 2030, backed by aggressive European and U.S. acquisitions. 🌞🌍 - $3.5B AI Infrastructure Push: The Abu Dhabi Government Digital Strategy 2025-2027 is embedding AI across public and private sectors. 🧠💻 - ADNOC’s Autonomous Energy Systems: A world-first in oil & gas, blending AI with energy production. ⛽🤖 - Semiconductor Supremacy: A $10B fabrication plant to secure the UAE’s role in the global chip supply chain. 🏭💾 Logistics: The UAE’s Silent Weapon in Global Trade: - $100B+ allocated to rail, ports, and metro expansion by 2035. 🚢🚇 - Jebel Ali Port’s AI Expansion: Doubling cargo capacity by 2030. 📦⚙️ - Freight & Passenger Rail Networks: Connecting economic zones, tightening the UAE’s grip on global trade routes. 🌍🚂 The U.S. Partnership: A $25B Strategic Play: The UAE’s latest U.S. commitment targets: ✅ AI-driven energy & infrastructure ✅ Strategic acquisitions in manufacturing & logistics ✅ Direct investments in biotech & tech firms This isn’t just diplomacy—it’s economic leverage. 🤝💡 Financial Gateways: How the UAE Moves Global Capital: - UAE-Australia CEPA: 99% tariff elimination, unlocking trade. 💼🌏 - Abu Dhabi & Shanghai Stock Exchanges: Cross-listed ETFs to bridge capital flows. 📊📈 - Emirates NBD & BlackRock: New private market vehicles, reinforcing the UAE as the capital connector between East and West. 💹💥 The UAE is no longer a regional player—it’s a global architect of economic transformation. With execution speed, sovereign capital, and strategic clarity, it’s rewriting the rules of energy, tech, and finance. 🚀🌍 For investors and executives, the question isn’t if to engage—it’s how fast. ⚡💡

And the numbers speak for themselves.In 2024, apartment prices soared by 𝗽𝗹𝘂𝘀 𝟮𝟯.𝟲%, with over 𝟲𝟬% 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗻𝘀𝗮𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 𝗺𝗮𝗱𝗲 𝗼𝗳𝗳-𝗽𝗹𝗮𝗻.Knight Frank forecasts another 𝗽𝗹𝘂𝘀 𝟴% 𝗶𝗻𝗰𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟱, followed by a gradual stabilization towards 2027, driven by 𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗿 𝟴𝟬,𝟬𝟬𝟬 𝘂𝗻𝗶𝘁𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗯𝗲 𝗱𝗲𝗹𝗶𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝗯𝘆 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟲.But the strongest driver is demographic pressure:𝗣𝗹𝘂𝘀 𝟭𝟲𝟵,𝟬𝟬𝟬 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗮𝗱𝗱𝗲𝗱 𝗶𝗻 𝗗𝘂𝗯𝗮𝗶 𝗶𝗻 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟰𝗣𝗹𝘂𝘀 𝟮𝟬𝟰,𝟬𝟬𝟬 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗶𝗻 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟱2040 urban master plan target: 𝟱.𝟴 𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝗗𝘂𝗯𝗮𝗶 (vs ~3.89 million in March 2025)⇒ The market is under pressure: both rents and sales prices continue rising across the city.𝗪𝗵𝗼’𝘀 𝗯𝘂𝘆𝗶𝗻𝗴?Investor profiles are crystal clear: •	𝗕𝗿𝗶𝘁𝗶𝘀𝗵: ~15% of all foreign real estate transactions •	𝗜𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗮𝗻𝘀: over 𝟯𝟱 𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗔𝗘𝗗 invested in 2024 •	𝗥𝘂𝘀𝘀𝗶𝗮𝗻𝘀: strong inflow since 2022, particularly in the ultra-luxury segment •	𝗖𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀𝗲: more than 𝟮𝟬 𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗔𝗘𝗗 invested, with double-digit growth expected in 2025 •	𝗦𝗮𝘂𝗱𝗶𝘀: 𝟭𝟴 𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗔𝗘𝗗, focusing on premium and seafront properties𝗘𝘂𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗮𝗻 𝗶𝗻𝘃𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝘀 (French, Italian, German, Canadian) are rising steadily, attracted by Dubai’s tax environment and 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝗿𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝘆𝗶𝗲𝗹𝗱𝘀 𝗯𝗲𝘁𝘄𝗲𝗲𝗻 𝟲–𝟴%, reaching 𝘂𝗽 𝘁𝗼 𝟭𝟭% in areas like Al Furjan and Dubai South.𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗮𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗮𝗽𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗽𝗿𝗶𝗰𝗲𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝗤𝟭 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟱: •	1-bedroom: 𝟭.𝟮 𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗔𝗘𝗗 •	2-bedroom: 𝟭.𝟴 𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗔𝗘𝗗 •	3-bedroom: 𝟮.𝟳 𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗔𝗘𝗗Forecasted increase: 𝗽𝗹𝘂𝘀 𝟭𝟱% 𝘁𝗼 𝟭𝟴% 𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗿 𝟯 𝘆𝗲𝗮𝗿𝘀, if current dynamics hold.The market is being driven by 3 pillars: 1.	A 𝘀𝘁𝗿𝘂𝗰𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗮𝗹 𝗶𝗻𝗳𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗼𝗳 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 2.	A 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗶𝗻𝘃𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁-𝗳𝗿𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗱𝗹𝘆 𝗹𝗲𝗴𝗮𝗹 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘁𝗮𝘅 𝗳𝗿𝗮𝗺𝗲𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸 3. Include with his Secretary.Because CEO himself was the mastermind of Mall’s new development plan. And he offered premium locations to other two brands on same floor while he was pushing us to go on the third floor.Finally with all frustration we quickly shut the shop and lost almost million in one and half year with not even single rent cheque bounced and no compensation from mall management. In 2024, the Dubai Chamber of Commerce achieved a major milestone by issuing and receiving a total of 5,357 ATA Carnets, which facilitated the temporary import of goods valued at an impressive AED 4.3 billion.What does this mean?ATA Carnets, often referred to as "merchandise passports," allow businesses to import goods temporarily, without paying duties or taxes, for up to one year. This is a game-changer for global events like exhibitions and conferences, simplifying customs procedures and ensuring smooth operations for organizers and exhibitors alike.Here’s how it works:🔹 Simplifies customs procedures for temporary imports🔹 Supports international exhibitions, trade shows, and conferences🔹 Enhances the UAE’s position as a global hub for business and eventsThis achievement is a direct result of strong collaboration between Dubai Chamber of Commerce, Dubai Customs، the Federal Customs Authority, and other chambers of commerce across the UAE.It’s exciting to see how the ATA Carnet system continues to strengthen Dubai’s role in global trade and events!How do you think the ATA Carnet system can further support global trade and business events? The UAE isn’t just participating in the global economy—it’s actively redesigning it. With the National Investment Strategy 2031, the country is deploying capital with surgical precision into AI, renewable energy, infrastructure, and global partnerships, transforming itself into the nexus of trade, finance, and innovation. 🌍💡 A Unified Vision with Distinct Emirate Roles: - Abu Dhabi: The AI and energy powerhouse, advancing semiconductor manufacturing and autonomous energy systems. 🤖⚡ - Dubai: The financial and digital assets hub, accelerating cross-border capital flows. 💰🌐 - Ras Al Khaimah: The rising star in tourism and real estate, diversifying the UAE’s economic engine. 🏝️🏠 This isn’t just growth—it’s strategic economic reengineering. 🚀By the Numbers: The UAE’s High-Impact Targets: - FDI Inflows: Surging from $30.5B (2023) to $65.4B (2031). 📈💵 - Foreign Investment Stock: Expanding from $218B to $600B. 📊💼 - Infrastructure: Over 1,000 km of new rail projects underway. 🚆📍 The message to global investors is clear: The UAE is where long-term capital thrives. 💡📈 Abu Dhabi’s AI & Energy Dominance: - Masdar’s 2026 IPO: A 100-gigawatt renewable energy portfolio by 2030, backed by aggressive European and U.S. acquisitions. 🌞🌍 - $3.5B AI Infrastructure Push: The Abu Dhabi Government Digital Strategy 2025-2027 is embedding AI across public and private sectors. 🧠💻 - ADNOC’s Autonomous Energy Systems: A world-first in oil & gas, blending AI with energy production. ⛽🤖 - Semiconductor Supremacy: A $10B fabrication plant to secure the UAE’s role in the global chip supply chain. 🏭💾 Logistics: The UAE’s Silent Weapon in Global Trade: - $100B+ allocated to rail, ports, and metro expansion by 2035. 🚢🚇 - Jebel Ali Port’s AI Expansion: Doubling cargo capacity by 2030. 📦⚙️ - Freight & Passenger Rail Networks: Connecting economic zones, tightening the UAE’s grip on global trade routes. 🌍🚂 The U.S. Partnership: A $25B Strategic Play: The UAE’s latest U.S. commitment targets: ✅ AI-driven energy & infrastructure ✅ Strategic acquisitions in manufacturing & logistics ✅ Direct investments in biotech & tech firms This isn’t just diplomacy—it’s economic leverage. 🤝💡 Financial Gateways: How the UAE Moves Global Capital: - UAE-Australia CEPA: 99% tariff elimination, unlocking trade. 💼🌏 - Abu Dhabi & Shanghai Stock Exchanges: Cross-listed ETFs to bridge capital flows. 📊📈 - Emirates NBD & BlackRock: New private market vehicles, reinforcing the UAE as the capital connector between East and West. 💹💥 The UAE is no longer a regional player—it’s a global architect of economic transformation. With execution speed, sovereign capital, and strategic clarity, it’s rewriting the rules of energy, tech, and finance. 🚀🌍 For investors and executives, the question isn’t if to engage—it’s how fast. ⚡💡

Username: Paul Withers - HR Recruitment ProfessionalPaul Withers - HR Recruitment Professional
Post Content: How I Can Help You Hire Into Your HR Team

𝗗𝘂𝗯𝗮𝗶’𝘀 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗹 𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝗺𝗮𝗿𝗸𝗲𝘁: 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝘀 𝗶𝘁 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴? 𝗪𝗵𝗼 𝗶𝘀 𝗶𝗻𝘃𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴? 𝗔𝗻𝗱 𝘄𝗵𝗼 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘄𝗲 𝗯𝘂𝗶𝗹𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗳𝗼𝗿?Dubai’s residential real estate market remains one of the most dynamic and international in the world. And the numbers speak for themselves.In 2024, apartment prices soared by 𝗽𝗹𝘂𝘀 𝟮𝟯.𝟲%, with over 𝟲𝟬% 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗻𝘀𝗮𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 𝗺𝗮𝗱𝗲 𝗼𝗳𝗳-𝗽𝗹𝗮𝗻.Knight Frank forecasts another 𝗽𝗹𝘂𝘀 𝟴% 𝗶𝗻𝗰𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟱, followed by a gradual stabilization towards 2027, driven by 𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗿 𝟴𝟬,𝟬𝟬𝟬 𝘂𝗻𝗶𝘁𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗯𝗲 𝗱𝗲𝗹𝗶𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝗯𝘆 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟲.But the strongest driver is demographic pressure:𝗣𝗹𝘂𝘀 𝟭𝟲𝟵,𝟬𝟬𝟬 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗮𝗱𝗱𝗲𝗱 𝗶𝗻 𝗗𝘂𝗯𝗮𝗶 𝗶𝗻 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟰𝗣𝗹𝘂𝘀 𝟮𝟬𝟰,𝟬𝟬𝟬 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗶𝗻 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟱2040 urban master plan target: 𝟱.𝟴 𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝗗𝘂𝗯𝗮𝗶 (vs ~3.89 million in March 2025)⇒ The market is under pressure: both rents and sales prices continue rising across the city.𝗪𝗵𝗼’𝘀 𝗯𝘂𝘆𝗶𝗻𝗴?Investor profiles are crystal clear: •	𝗕𝗿𝗶𝘁𝗶𝘀𝗵: ~15% of all foreign real estate transactions •	𝗜𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗮𝗻𝘀: over 𝟯𝟱 𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗔𝗘𝗗 invested in 2024 •	𝗥𝘂𝘀𝘀𝗶𝗮𝗻𝘀: strong inflow since 2022, particularly in the ultra-luxury segment •	𝗖𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀𝗲: more than 𝟮𝟬 𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗔𝗘𝗗 invested, with double-digit growth expected in 2025 •	𝗦𝗮𝘂𝗱𝗶𝘀: 𝟭𝟴 𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗔𝗘𝗗, focusing on premium and seafront properties𝗘𝘂𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗮𝗻 𝗶𝗻𝘃𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝘀 (French, Italian, German, Canadian) are rising steadily, attracted by Dubai’s tax environment and 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝗿𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝘆𝗶𝗲𝗹𝗱𝘀 𝗯𝗲𝘁𝘄𝗲𝗲𝗻 𝟲–𝟴%, reaching 𝘂𝗽 𝘁𝗼 𝟭𝟭% in areas like Al Furjan and Dubai South.𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗮𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗮𝗽𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗽𝗿𝗶𝗰𝗲𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝗤𝟭 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟱: •	1-bedroom: 𝟭.𝟮 𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗔𝗘𝗗 •	2-bedroom: 𝟭.𝟴 𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗔𝗘𝗗 •	3-bedroom: 𝟮.𝟳 𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗔𝗘𝗗Forecasted increase: 𝗽𝗹𝘂𝘀 𝟭𝟱% 𝘁𝗼 𝟭𝟴% 𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗿 𝟯 𝘆𝗲𝗮𝗿𝘀, if current dynamics hold.The market is being driven by 3 pillars: 1.	A 𝘀𝘁𝗿𝘂𝗰𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗮𝗹 𝗶𝗻𝗳𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗼𝗳 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 2.	A 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗶𝗻𝘃𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁-𝗳𝗿𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗱𝗹𝘆 𝗹𝗲𝗴𝗮𝗹 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘁𝗮𝘅 𝗳𝗿𝗮𝗺𝗲𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸 3.	𝗥𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗿𝗲𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗻𝘀 𝘀𝗶𝗴𝗻𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗻𝘁𝗹𝘆 𝗮𝗯𝗼𝘃𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗴𝗹𝗼𝗯𝗮𝗹 𝗰𝗮𝗽𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹𝘀Dubai is no longer just growing — it is 𝗮𝘁𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴, 𝘀𝗲𝗹𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗿𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗹 𝗰𝗮𝗽𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗲𝗻𝘁.

We signed lease June 2021, vacated on January 2023 and till now that place is empty and new development is not making any impact to that site far and far 😃.The purpose of story is that we lost almost AED 20-25k per month+ investment and time and Imagine December 2022  was the first month we observe business in profit and We were kicked out after rounding all ariund but found helpless. Include with his Secretary.Because CEO himself was the mastermind of Mall’s new development plan. And he offered premium locations to other two brands on same floor while he was pushing us to go on the third floor.Finally with all frustration we quickly shut the shop and lost almost million in one and half year with not even single rent cheque bounced and no compensation from mall management.  Due to loan/financial debt had to sold house in India recently to at least survive and lost health too. Today is the day, struggling for daily bread and butter caused of such huge financial loss. In 2024, the Dubai Chamber of Commerce achieved a major milestone by issuing and receiving a total of 5,357 ATA Carnets, which facilitated the temporary import of goods valued at an impressive AED 4.3 billion.What does this mean?ATA Carnets, often referred to as "merchandise passports," allow businesses to import goods temporarily, without paying duties or taxes, for up to one year. This is a game-changer for global events like exhibitions and conferences, simplifying customs procedures and ensuring smooth operations for organizers and exhibitors alike.Here’s how it works:🔹 Simplifies customs procedures for temporary imports🔹 Supports international exhibitions, trade shows, and conferences🔹 Enhances the UAE’s position as a global hub for business and eventsThis achievement is a direct result of strong collaboration between Dubai Chamber of Commerce, Dubai Customs، the Federal Customs Authority, and other chambers of commerce across the UAE.It’s exciting to see how the ATA Carnet system continues to strengthen Dubai’s role in global trade and events!How do you think the ATA Carnet system can further support global trade and business events? The UAE isn’t just participating in the global economy—it’s actively redesigning it. With the National Investment Strategy 2031, the country is deploying capital with surgical precision into AI, renewable energy, infrastructure, and global partnerships, transforming itself into the nexus of trade, finance, and innovation. 🌍💡 A Unified Vision with Distinct Emirate Roles: - Abu Dhabi: The AI and energy powerhouse, advancing semiconductor manufacturing and autonomous energy systems. 🤖⚡ - Dubai: The financial and digital assets hub, accelerating cross-border capital flows. 💰🌐 - Ras Al Khaimah: The rising star in tourism and real estate, diversifying the UAE’s economic engine. 🏝️🏠 This isn’t just growth—it’s strategic economic reengineering. 🚀By the Numbers: The UAE’s High-Impact Targets: - FDI Inflows: Surging from $30.5B (2023) to $65.4B (2031). 📈💵 - Foreign Investment Stock: Expanding from $218B to $600B. 📊💼 - Infrastructure: Over 1,000 km of new rail projects underway. 🚆📍 The message to global investors is clear: The UAE is where long-term capital thrives. 💡📈 Abu Dhabi’s AI & Energy Dominance: - Masdar’s 2026 IPO: A 100-gigawatt renewable energy portfolio by 2030, backed by aggressive European and U.S. acquisitions. 🌞🌍 - $3.5B AI Infrastructure Push: The Abu Dhabi Government Digital Strategy 2025-2027 is embedding AI across public and private sectors. 🧠💻 - ADNOC’s Autonomous Energy Systems: A world-first in oil & gas, blending AI with energy production. ⛽🤖 - Semiconductor Supremacy: A $10B fabrication plant to secure the UAE’s role in the global chip supply chain. 🏭💾 Logistics: The UAE’s Silent Weapon in Global Trade: - $100B+ allocated to rail, ports, and metro expansion by 2035. 🚢🚇 - Jebel Ali Port’s AI Expansion: Doubling cargo capacity by 2030. 📦⚙️ - Freight & Passenger Rail Networks: Connecting economic zones, tightening the UAE’s grip on global trade routes. 🌍🚂 The U.S. Partnership: A $25B Strategic Play: The UAE’s latest U.S. commitment targets: ✅ AI-driven energy & infrastructure ✅ Strategic acquisitions in manufacturing & logistics ✅ Direct investments in biotech & tech firms This isn’t just diplomacy—it’s economic leverage. 🤝💡 Financial Gateways: How the UAE Moves Global Capital: - UAE-Australia CEPA: 99% tariff elimination, unlocking trade. 💼🌏 - Abu Dhabi & Shanghai Stock Exchanges: Cross-listed ETFs to bridge capital flows. 📊📈 - Emirates NBD & BlackRock: New private market vehicles, reinforcing the UAE as the capital connector between East and West. 💹💥 The UAE is no longer a regional player—it’s a global architect of economic transformation. With execution speed, sovereign capital, and strategic clarity, it’s rewriting the rules of energy, tech, and finance. 🚀🌍 For investors and executives, the question isn’t if to engage—it’s how fast. ⚡💡

𝗗𝘂𝗯𝗮𝗶’𝘀 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗹 𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝗺𝗮𝗿𝗸𝗲𝘁: 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝘀 𝗶𝘁 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴? 𝗪𝗵𝗼 𝗶𝘀 𝗶𝗻𝘃𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴? 𝗔𝗻𝗱 𝘄𝗵𝗼 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘄𝗲 𝗯𝘂𝗶𝗹𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗳𝗼𝗿?Dubai’s residential real estate market remains one of the most dynamic and international in the world. And the numbers speak for themselves.In 2024, apartment prices soared by 𝗽𝗹𝘂𝘀 𝟮𝟯.𝟲%, with over 𝟲𝟬% 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗻𝘀𝗮𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 𝗺𝗮𝗱𝗲 𝗼𝗳𝗳-𝗽𝗹𝗮𝗻.Knight Frank forecasts another 𝗽𝗹𝘂𝘀 𝟴% 𝗶𝗻𝗰𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟱, followed by a gradual stabilization towards 2027, driven by 𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗿 𝟴𝟬,𝟬𝟬𝟬 𝘂𝗻𝗶𝘁𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗯𝗲 𝗱𝗲𝗹𝗶𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝗯𝘆 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟲.But the strongest driver is demographic pressure:𝗣𝗹𝘂𝘀 𝟭𝟲𝟵,𝟬𝟬𝟬 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗮𝗱𝗱𝗲𝗱 𝗶𝗻 𝗗𝘂𝗯𝗮𝗶 𝗶𝗻 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟰𝗣𝗹𝘂𝘀 𝟮𝟬𝟰,𝟬𝟬𝟬 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗶𝗻 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟱2040 urban master plan target: 𝟱.𝟴 𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝗗𝘂𝗯𝗮𝗶 (vs ~3.89 million in March 2025)⇒ The market is under pressure: both rents and sales prices continue rising across the city.𝗪𝗵𝗼’𝘀 𝗯𝘂𝘆𝗶𝗻𝗴?Investor profiles are crystal clear: •	𝗕𝗿𝗶𝘁𝗶𝘀𝗵: ~15% of all foreign real estate transactions •	𝗜𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗮𝗻𝘀: over 𝟯𝟱 𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗔𝗘𝗗 invested in 2024 •	𝗥𝘂𝘀𝘀𝗶𝗮𝗻𝘀: strong inflow since 2022, particularly in the ultra-luxury segment •	𝗖𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀𝗲: more than 𝟮𝟬 𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗔𝗘𝗗 invested, with double-digit growth expected in 2025 •	𝗦𝗮𝘂𝗱𝗶𝘀: 𝟭𝟴 𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗔𝗘𝗗, focusing on premium and seafront properties𝗘𝘂𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗮𝗻 𝗶𝗻𝘃𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝘀 (French, Italian, German, Canadian) are rising steadily, attracted by Dubai’s tax environment and 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝗿𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝘆𝗶𝗲𝗹𝗱𝘀 𝗯𝗲𝘁𝘄𝗲𝗲𝗻 𝟲–𝟴%, reaching 𝘂𝗽 𝘁𝗼 𝟭𝟭% in areas like Al Furjan and Dubai South.𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗮𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗮𝗽𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗽𝗿𝗶𝗰𝗲𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝗤𝟭 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟱: •	1-bedroom: 𝟭.𝟮 𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗔𝗘𝗗 •	2-bedroom: 𝟭.𝟴 𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗔𝗘𝗗 •	3-bedroom: 𝟮.𝟳 𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗔𝗘𝗗Forecasted increase: 𝗽𝗹𝘂𝘀 𝟭𝟱% 𝘁𝗼 𝟭𝟴% 𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗿 𝟯 𝘆𝗲𝗮𝗿𝘀, if current dynamics hold.The market is being driven by 3 pillars: 1.	A 𝘀𝘁𝗿𝘂𝗰𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗮𝗹 𝗶𝗻𝗳𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗼𝗳 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 2.	A 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗶𝗻𝘃𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁-𝗳𝗿𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗱𝗹𝘆 𝗹𝗲𝗴𝗮𝗹 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘁𝗮𝘅 𝗳𝗿𝗮𝗺𝗲𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸 3.	𝗥𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗿𝗲𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗻𝘀 𝘀𝗶𝗴𝗻𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗻𝘁𝗹𝘆 𝗮𝗯𝗼𝘃𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗴𝗹𝗼𝗯𝗮𝗹 𝗰𝗮𝗽𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹𝘀Dubai is no longer just growing — it is 𝗮𝘁𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴, 𝘀𝗲𝗹𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗿𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗹 𝗰𝗮𝗽𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗲𝗻𝘁.

Sample historic sites and the vibrant cosmopolitan life of Dubai on this tour starting in the popular Jumeirah district. Make a stop at the traditionally recreated Madinat Souk for stunning photos of the iconic Burj Al Arab Hotel then drive onto the man-made Palm Jumeirah island, an incredible architectural marvel for a closer look at another icon, the Atlantis Resort. Continue along Jumeirah Beach, the picturesque palace and residential area of Dubai to a photo-stop at the famed Jumeirah Mosque. Next, head to Al Bastakiya, the old part of Dubai. Pass the Al Fahidi Fort, the ruling family’s former residence and take an Abra (water taxi) to sail across Dubai Creek. In 2024, the Dubai Chamber of Commerce achieved a major milestone by issuing and receiving a total of 5,357 ATA Carnets, which facilitated the temporary import of goods valued at an impressive AED 4.3 billion.What does this mean?ATA Carnets, often referred to as "merchandise passports," allow businesses to import goods temporarily, without paying duties or taxes, for up to one year. This is a game-changer for global events like exhibitions and conferences, simplifying customs procedures and ensuring smooth operations for organizers and exhibitors alike.Here’s how it works:🔹 Simplifies customs procedures for temporary imports🔹 Supports international exhibitions, trade shows, and conferences🔹 Enhances the UAE’s position as a global hub for business and eventsThis achievement is a direct result of strong collaboration between Dubai Chamber of Commerce, Dubai Customs، the Federal Customs Authority, and other chambers of commerce across the UAE.It’s exciting to see how the ATA Carnet system continues to strengthen Dubai’s role in global trade and events!How do you think the ATA Carnet system can further support global trade and business events? The UAE isn’t just participating in the global economy—it’s actively redesigning it. With the National Investment Strategy 2031, the country is deploying capital with surgical precision into AI, renewable energy, infrastructure, and global partnerships, transforming itself into the nexus of trade, finance, and innovation. 🌍💡 A Unified Vision with Distinct Emirate Roles: - Abu Dhabi: The AI and energy powerhouse, advancing semiconductor manufacturing and autonomous energy systems. 🤖⚡ - Dubai: The financial and digital assets hub, accelerating cross-border capital flows. 💰🌐 - Ras Al Khaimah: The rising star in tourism and real estate, diversifying the UAE’s economic engine. 🏝️🏠 This isn’t just growth—it’s strategic economic reengineering. 🚀By the Numbers: The UAE’s High-Impact Targets: - FDI Inflows: Surging from $30.5B (2023) to $65.4B (2031). 📈💵 - Foreign Investment Stock: Expanding from $218B to $600B. 📊💼 - Infrastructure: Over 1,000 km of new rail projects underway. 🚆📍 The message to global investors is clear: The UAE is where long-term capital thrives. 💡📈 Abu Dhabi’s AI & Energy Dominance: - Masdar’s 2026 IPO: A 100-gigawatt renewable energy portfolio by 2030, backed by aggressive European and U.S. acquisitions. 🌞🌍 - $3.5B AI Infrastructure Push: The Abu Dhabi Government Digital Strategy 2025-2027 is embedding AI across public and private sectors. 🧠💻 - ADNOC’s Autonomous Energy Systems: A world-first in oil & gas, blending AI with energy production. ⛽🤖 - Semiconductor Supremacy: A $10B fabrication plant to secure the UAE’s role in the global chip supply chain. 🏭💾 Logistics: The UAE’s Silent Weapon in Global Trade: - $100B+ allocated to rail, ports, and metro expansion by 2035. 🚢🚇 - Jebel Ali Port’s AI Expansion: Doubling cargo capacity by 2030. 📦⚙️ - Freight & Passenger Rail Networks: Connecting economic zones, tightening the UAE’s grip on global trade routes. 🌍🚂 The U.S. Partnership: A $25B Strategic Play: The UAE’s latest U.S. commitment targets: ✅ AI-driven energy & infrastructure ✅ Strategic acquisitions in manufacturing & logistics ✅ Direct investments in biotech & tech firms This isn’t just diplomacy—it’s economic leverage. 🤝💡 Financial Gateways: How the UAE Moves Global Capital: - UAE-Australia CEPA: 99% tariff elimination, unlocking trade. 💼🌏 - Abu Dhabi & Shanghai Stock Exchanges: Cross-listed ETFs to bridge capital flows. 📊📈 - Emirates NBD & BlackRock: New private market vehicles, reinforcing the UAE as the capital connector between East and West. 💹💥 The UAE is no longer a regional player—it’s a global architect of economic transformation. With execution speed, sovereign capital, and strategic clarity, it’s rewriting the rules of energy, tech, and finance. 🚀🌍 For investors and executives, the question isn’t if to engage—it’s how fast. ⚡💡

Sample historic sites and the vibrant cosmopolitan life of Dubai on this tour starting in the popular Jumeirah district. Make a stop at the traditionally recreated Madinat Souk for stunning photos of the iconic Burj Al Arab Hotel then drive onto the man-made Palm Jumeirah island, an incredible architectural marvel for a closer look at another icon, the Atlantis Resort. Continue along Jumeirah Beach, the picturesque palace and residential area of Dubai to a photo-stop at the famed Jumeirah Mosque. Next, head to Al Bastakiya, the old part of Dubai. Pass the Al Fahidi Fort, the ruling family’s former residence and take an Abra (water taxi) to sail across Dubai Creek. Disembark at the Spice Souk where the fragrances of the orient come together then there is time to shop in one of the most visited sites of Dubai – the Gold Souk. Sharing A sad story of investor in Dubaihad worst experience with hashtag#Burjumanmall Al Ghurair Al Ghurair Group management were change right after three months as we leased a shop in BurJuman Mall @al Dubai . unfortunately the new leasing director Vythnathan M. kept pushing us right after joining that we have to relocate or vacate the shop but all verbally and when I sent email to make it confirm he responded officially after a year and sent an letter with courier to vacate the shop within 15days.because this area falls under new development plan. Imagine three months only we completed in the mall as a new tanent and we invest a lot of money. Anyhow we managed to cover almost 18 months while he didn’t offer any feasible location as replacement.I asked three location he refused but those three given to other brands and option which he offered to others now and the one for what we had convinced him a lot, he offered to other brand one in right half rent what he told us and given excuse that this is prime location and we wanted only a well known brand. while it’s the first shop same as us. We signed lease June 2021, vacated on January 2023 and till now that place is empty and new development is not making any impact to that site far and far 😃.The purpose of story is that we lost almost AED 20-25k per month+ investment and time and Imagine December 2022  was the first month we observe business in profit and We were kicked out after rounding all ariund but found helpless. Include with his Secretary.Because CEO himself was the mastermind of Mall’s new development plan. And he offered premium locations to other two brands on same floor while he was pushing us to go on the third floor.Finally with all frustration we quickly shut the shop and lost almost million in one and half year with not even single rent cheque bounced and no compensation from mall management.  Due to loan/financial debt had to sold house in India recently to at least survive and lost health too. Today is the day, struggling for daily bread and butter caused of such huge financial loss.
